TopicTitle: Key for returning time warp to 1x

Articles.Content:
Several times I have experienced overshooting my thrust window while time warping, simply because it takes some time to toggle through the different warp speeds and down to normal speed. A simple solution would be to have a key bound to returning the warp speed to normal, similar to the way x works with thrust. Excactly which key this is has little significance, although it should either be close to the default warp keys, or easily reachable from WASD. As such, both the key to the right of . and the z-key are good alternatives without any use in-game as of now.

EDIT: The same goes for parking brakes. Generally, I think every function that it is likely that you will need during flight/control of a craft, should be bindable, if not bound by default.

Edited October 23, 2013 by Lagostra

This has been suggested several time: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/50055-one-button-that-kills-ALL-time-acceleration?highlight=kill+timewarp

Doing it will greatly increase the chance for the rocket to explose or disassemble, because it will go from high speed to lower speed in no time.

Sorry that I did not see this suggestion; I did search for it, and also looked through the sticky, but I can't have been thorough enough... But the functionality to slow down time with a single press is, as mentioned in this thread, already present in the game: you can click on the controls in the upper left corner. All I'm really asking for, is for this function to be bindable to a key
